Free cookie consent management tool by  TermsFeed Builders Hardware Manufacturers Association | BHMA We use cookies We use cookies and other tracking technologies to improve your browsing experience on our website, to show you personalized content and targeted ads, to analyze our website traffic, and to understand where our visitors are coming from. Hudnut Distinguished Service Award BHMA Launches Codes Report This edition of Codes In Context is the first in a series of reports that provide relevant hardware changes and updates during the various code cycles. Learn More Be safe. Be secure. Look for the mark. BHMA is the only organization accredited by ANSI to develop and maintain performance standards for locks, closers, exit devices and other builders hardware. The BHMA Certified® Products Directory (CPD) lists all products that have been certified to meet ANSI/BHMA standards. Product Grade LEVELS Product grades (1, 2 or 3) for hardware items are defined within most ANSI/BHMA standards. Prev Next BHMA Spotlight Series: Justin Crotzer Name Title Series Topic Standards Get Certified BHMA makes it easy to understand ANSI/BHMA A 156 series standards. Get quick, one-page summaries through our Hardware Highlights series. Testing Manufacturers voluntarily submit a hardware product to independent laboratory testing to confirm that the product fully meets the criteria of its ANSI/BHMA standard. Testing is conducted on a regular basis. A security test is shown here. Secure Home™ The BHMA® Secure Home™ Label helps residential contractors and homeowners purchase the best hardware for their needs by testing to these three areas: security, durability and finish. Search BHMA Certified® Products For complete listings of BHMA Certified® Products, view the BHMA Certified® Products Directory (CPD). The listings in this directory are performance-oriented standards having cycle, operational, strength, security, and finish test requirements. Search Now Participate in the BHMA® Certification Program by voluntarily submitting a hardware product to independent laboratory testing to confirm that it fully meets the criteria of the appropriate ANSI/BHMA® standard.  This industry-wide certification program does not call for a manufacturer to be a BHMA® member in order to certify its products. 529 14th Street, NW, Suite 1280 Phone: 212 297 2122 bhma@kellencompany.com © Copyright 2024 Builders Hardware Manufacturers Association Privacy Policy Terms and Conditions

action_input: "Builders Hardware Manufacturers Association is a scam"
observation: [{'url': 'https://buildershardware.com/News/BHMA-Blog/what-is-bhma-why-is-it-important', 'content': 'What is BHMA? Builders Hardware Manufacturers Association, or BHMA, is a trade association that is committed to promoting the quality and performance of builders hardware products and providing education and standards development. For nearly a century it has represented manufacturers and suppliers of builders hardware products and has advocated for the interests of the industry as a whole ...'}, {'url': 'https://securehome.org/resources-faqs/', 'content': 'The Builders Hardware Manufacturers Association is the only organization accredited by the America National Standards Institute (ANSI) to develop and maintain performance standards for door hardware.Any product bearing the BHMA Certified® Secure Home™ label has been tested and audited according to these standards—the highest in the industry—to ensure product quality.'}, {'url': 'https://www.allegion.ca/content/dam/allegion-us-2/web-documents-2/Article/Allegion_Understanding_BHMA_Article_112079.pdf', 'content': 'test for each component of hardware." What is BHMA? BHMA is the trade association for North American manufacturers of commercial builders\' hardware. It plays an important role in ensuring the quality and performance of builders\' hardware, as well as standards, codes and life safety regulations that impact the industry. Architects,'}, {'url': 'https://www.constructionspecifier.com/shedding-light-on-builders-hardware-manufacturers-association-updated-standards/', 'content': 'The American National Standards Institute (ANSI) and the Builders Hardware Manufacturers Association (BHMA) set forth standards that are used by specifiers, architects, and other key players in the construction world. These standards apply to a diverse array of hardware and are updated every five years as required by ANSI.'}, {'url': 'https://buildershardware.com/', 'content': 'Get quick, one-page summaries through our Hardware Highlights series. Manufacturers voluntarily submit a hardware product to independent laboratory testing to confirm that the product fully meets the criteria of its ANSI/BHMA standard. Testing is conducted on a regular basis. A security test is shown here.'}]
